title: Persistent world
summary: A persistent world or persistent state world (PSW) is a virtual world which, by the definition by Richard Bartle, "continues to exist and develop internally even when there are no people interacting with it".[1] The first virtual worlds were text-based and often called MUDs, but the term is frequently used in relation to massively multiplayer online role-playing games (MMORPGs)[1] and pervasive games.[2] Examples of persistent worlds that exist in video games include Battle Dawn, EVE Online, and Realms of Trinity.
